snippet: President Obama faces a challenge as he seeks to advertise the nation’s financial recovery while arguing for action to help a still-besieged middle class.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama's latest economic address, in which he emphasizes nation's financial recovery while arguing that people need help, defies White House's traditional logic of emphasizing good news over the bad; speech highlights Obama's 2014 strategy toward navigating today's complex economy, in which the recession has eased and the rich have profited, but the middle class continues to flounder.
lead_paragraph: President Obama faces a challenge as he seeks to advertise the nation’s financial recovery while arguing for action to help a still-besieged middle class.

headline.main: Obama Speaks of Better Days for Economy, With Asterisk
